metadata.title: Thursday, 7th March, 2013
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    what caused the death of a student at the Evelyn Hone College of Applied Arts and Commerce, on Tuesday, 19th February, 2013; and
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to forestall further loss  of life at the College and other public institutions of higher learning.
(a)    whether Government is aware of an outbreak of a rice disease in Liuwa Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b)    if so, what measures Government has taken to contain the disease.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs when the Government will provide a motor vehicle to Mwinilunga Police Station for operations.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how much money was allocated to the development of infrastructure in Lubansenshi Parliamentary Constituency in 2012;
(b)    of the total allocation, how much money was actually disbursed, by school and by project; and
(c)    what measures were taken to ensure that the money was spent on the intended projects. 500 Mr Mucheleka (Lubansenshi) - to ask the Minister of Justice:
(a)    how much money will be spent on the Constitution making process at the end of the exercise; and
(b)    on what specific activities the money will be spent.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational  Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    what major projects the National Technology Business Centre (NTBC) implemented between October, 2011 and September, 2012;
(b)    what the total cost of implementing the projects was; and
(c)    what role the NTBC plays in staff development in research institutions in the country.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the Government will provide a dredger and more funding for clearing the canals in Nchelenge District;
